snippet: The Florida man who flew a gyrocopter onto the grounds of the United States Capitol last month faces up to 9 ½ years in prison after being indicted by a federal grand jury on Wednesday.
abstract: Douglas Hughes, Florida man who flew gyrocopter onto grounds of United States Capitol in April, is indicted on six charges, including violation of national defense airspace, and faces up to 9 and a half years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The Florida man who flew a gyrocopter onto the grounds of the United States Capitol last month faces up to 9 ½ years in prison after being indicted by a federal grand jury on Wednesday.

headline.main: Mail Carrier Indicted in Flight of Gyrocopter Onto Capitol Grounds
headline.print_headline: Mail Carrier Indicted in Flight of Gyrocopter Onto Capitol Grounds
